---
title: "Offshore Scallop Spring Survey Industry Report 2025"
author: "Tricia Pearo Drew"
date: "`r format(Sys.Date(), '%b-%d-%Y')`"
output: 
  pdf_document: default
editor_options:
  chunk_output_type: console
classoption: landscape
header-includes:
   - \usepackage{caption}
geometry: margin=15mm
---

This report contains summary information on the distribution and relative abundance of sea scallops that were observed during the 2025 Offshore Scallop Spring Survey. This survey included Georges Bank and the following areas on the Scotian Shelf: Middle Bank, Sable/Western Bank, Browns Bank South, Browns Bank North and German Bank.
The survey was conducted from May 12th to June 9th aboard the Fundy Leader. This year, 8 of 14 crew were new to the survey. There was a total of 353 stations completed over three survey legs. The first leg consisted of 15 stations on Middle Bank and 100 stations on Sable/Western Bank. The second leg consisted of 24 monitoring stations on Georges Bank, 25 stations on Browns Bank South, 106 stations on Browns Bank North (6 extra stations) and 28 stations on German Bank. The third leg consisted of 55 stations on German Bank (3 extra stations).


\newpage


```{r setup1, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, include=FALSE}
library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)
library(sf)
require(ROracle)
library(kableExtra)
require(rnaturalearth)
require(rnaturalearthdata)
library(tiff)
library(data.table)
require(xlsx)


#Connect to database and pull data for industry report
con= dbConnect(DBI::dbDriver("Oracle"), 'Username', 'Password', 'ptran')
svydat=dbGetQuery(con, (" select *
from scaloff.osindustryreport_ss_vw
where cruise like '%LE21%'")) #change year accordingly

source("Y:/Offshore/Assessment/Assessment_fns/Survey_and_OSAC/convert.dd.dddd.r")
svydat$LAT<-convert.dd.dddd(svydat$START_LAT,format='dec.deg') #add Latitude column and its #converted location
svydat$LON<-convert.dd.dddd(svydat$START_LON,format='dec.deg') #add Longitude column and its #converted location

#To find total live and clappers:
Totallive = c("LIVE_LESS_THAN_70", "LIVE_70_TO_LESS_THAN_100", "LIVE_100_AND_GREATER")
Totaldead = c("DEAD_LESS_THAN_70", "DEAD_70_TO_LESS_THAN_100", "DEAD_100_AND_GREATER")
svydat$Total_Live<-rowSums(svydat[,Totallive])
svydat$Total_Dead<-rowSums(svydat[,Totaldead])

#Add a tow type column
svydat$TOW_TYPE[svydat$TOW_NO < 899] <- "Regular"
svydat$TOW_TYPE[svydat$TOW_NO > 900] <- "Extra"

#Change column names
names(svydat)[names(svydat) == 'MGT_AREA_CD'] <- 'AREA'
names(svydat)[names(svydat) == 'LIVE_LESS_THAN_70'] <- 'LIVE <70mm'
names(svydat)[names(svydat) == 'LIVE_70_TO_LESS_THAN_100'] <- 'LIVE 70-100mm'
names(svydat)[names(svydat) == 'LIVE_100_AND_GREATER'] <- 'LIVE $\\ge$100mm'
names(svydat)[names(svydat) == 'DEAD_LESS_THAN_70'] <- 'CLAPPERS <70mm'
names(svydat)[names(svydat) == 'DEAD_70_TO_LESS_THAN_100'] <- 'CLAPPERS 70-100mm'
names(svydat)[names(svydat) == 'DEAD_100_AND_GREATER'] <- 'CLAPPERS $\\ge$100mm'
names(svydat)[names(svydat) == 'PCT_CLAPPERS'] <- '% CLAPPERS'
names(svydat)[names(svydat) == 'CATCH_BASKETS'] <- 'NUMBER OF BASKETS'
names(svydat)[names(svydat) == 'START_LAT'] <- 'START_LAT_N'
names(svydat)[names(svydat) == 'START_LON'] <- 'START_LON_W'
names(svydat)[names(svydat) == 'END_LAT'] <- 'END_LAT_N'
names(svydat)[names(svydat) == 'END_LON'] <- 'END_LON_W'
names(svydat)[names(svydat) == 'DEPTH_F'] <- 'DEPTH_FATHOMS'
```


```{r Figure 1, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
#Use ifelse() to create new columns that tell you whether the tow has more than the number of #baskets/comm/juveniles specified. Give the column a 1 if it DOES, 0 if it doesn't. Then we can just add #them up with dplyr later. 
svydat$gr2ba <- ifelse(svydat$`NUMBER OF BASKETS` > 1.99, 1, 0)
svydat$gr200comm <- ifelse(svydat$`LIVE $\\ge$100mm` > 199, 1, 0)
svydat$gr500juv <- ifelse(svydat$"LIVE <70mm" > 499, 1, 0)

#Use dplyr to sum up these columns by area and tow type. 
Table1 <- svydat %>%
   group_by(CRUISE, AREA, TOW_TYPE) %>%
   summarise(notow = n_distinct(TOW_NO),
           live = round(sum(Total_Live)),
            gr2ba = sum(gr2ba), 
            gr200comm = sum(gr200comm),
            gr500juv = sum(gr500juv))

# Can remove NAs and replace with a dash in table, do this before we change the names to keep it cleaner
Table1$gr500juv[is.na(Table1$gr500juv)] <-  "--"
Table1$gr2ba[is.na(Table1$gr2ba)] <- "--"
Table1$gr200comm[is.na(Table1$gr200comm)] <- "--"
Table1$live[is.na(Table1$live)] <-  "--"

#rename columns in Table1
Table1names <-c('CRUISE', 'AREA', 'STATION TYPE','NUMBER OF STATIONS', 'TOTAL LIVE SCALLOPS', 'NUMBER OF STATIONS $\\ge$ 2 BASKETS', 'NUMBER OF STATIONS $\\ge$ 200 COMMERCIAL SCALLOPS', 'NUMBER OF STATIONS $\\ge$ 500 JUVENILES')
names(Table1) <- Table1names

#Put the Regular station above the Extras
Table1 <- arrange(Table1, AREA, desc(`STATION TYPE`))

#Always put the code below at the end when making a table in kable format
Table1 %>%
 kbl(caption = "Bank summaries for the 2025 Offshore Scallop Spring Survey. Scallop numbers are unstandardized. Commercial scallops are defined as $\\ge$ 100mm. Juveniles are < 70mm (slightly under 3 inches) shell height." ,booktabs = TRUE, format='latex', escape=F, linesep = "") %>%
  column_spec(1:3, width = "1cm") %>%
  column_spec(4:ncol(Table1), width = "3cm") %>%
  kable_styling(latex_options = c("HOLD_position", "scale_down"))

```


```{r table2, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
#Make table for each bank (GBa) for catch summary
table2 <- svydat %>%
  filter(AREA == "Mid") %>%
  select(-YEAR,-CRUISE,-SURVEY_NAME,-SPECIES_ID, -Total_Live, -Total_Dead, -gr2ba, -gr200comm, -gr500juv, -LAT, -LON, -TOW_TYPE) %>%
  #or write column names in order that I want mgt_area, tow_no, etc.in select()
  arrange(TOW_NO)
#to change basket 0 to <0.25 when live is >1
table2$test <- table2$`LIVE <70mm` + table2$`LIVE 70-100mm`+ table2$`LIVE $\\ge$100mm`

#table2$BASKETS[table2$test > 0 & table2$BASKETS == 0] or table2[table2$test > 0 & table2$BASKETS == 0,] $BASKETS
table2[table2$test > 0 & table2$`NUMBER OF BASKETS` == 0,] $'NUMBER OF BASKETS' <- "<0.25"

cols <- c("LIVE <70mm", "LIVE 70-100mm", "LIVE $\\ge$100mm", "CLAPPERS <70mm", "CLAPPERS 70-100mm", "CLAPPERS $\\ge$100mm","% CLAPPERS")

table2 <- table2 %>%
   mutate(across(cols, round, 0)) %>%
  select(-test)

names(table2) <- c("AREA", "TOW NO.", "START LAT (N)", "START LON (W)", "END LAT (N)", "END LON (W)", "DEPTH (F)", "NO. BASKETS", "<70mm", "70-100mm", "$\\ge$100mm", "<70mm", "70-100mm", "$\\ge$100mm", "$\\%$ CLAPPERS")

out2 <- table2
names(out2) <- c("AREA", "TOW NO.", "START LAT (N)", "START LON (W)", "END LAT (N)", "END LON (W)", "DEPTH (F)", "NO. BASKETS", "LIVE <70mm", "LIVE 70-100mm", "LIVE \u2265 100mm", "CLAPPERS <70mm", "CLAPPERS 70-100mm", "CLAPPERS \u2265 100mm", "% CLAPPERS")
write.xlsx(out2, file="IndustryReportTablesMid.xlsx", sheetName="Table 2.")

table2 %>% 
  kbl(caption = "Catch Summary Report for Middle Bank stations surveyed during the 2025 Offshore Scallop Spring Survey. Scallop numbers are unstandardized.",booktabs = TRUE, format="latex", longtable = T, escape=F, linesep = "") %>%
  add_header_above(c(" "= 8, "LIVE" = 3, "CLAPPERS" = 3, " ")) %>%
  column_spec(1:2, width = "0.75cm") %>%
  column_spec(3:6, width = "1.3cm") %>%
  column_spec(7, width = "1cm") %>%
  column_spec(8, width = "1.75cm") %>%
  column_spec(9:14, width = "1cm") %>%
  column_spec(15, width = "2cm") %>%
  kable_styling(latex_options = c("HOLD_position", "repeat_header"))#can use striped, basic, etc
```
